summary: This is an email exchange between individuals with US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) email addresses, discussing scheduling a call to talk about scanning data to be loaded to the Relativity platform for the case US v. Epstein. It appears to be a technical/logistical coordination related to evidence management.

persons.name: A. Nimini
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email proposing a call time to discuss scanning data for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Y. Conn
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (in the 'To' field) of an email from A. Nimini regarding scheduling a call about the Epstein case data.

connections.description: Correspondents within or associated with the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on technical aspects of the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination call scheduled for US v. Epstein case data
events.description: An email exchange to schedule a call to discuss scanning data to be loaded to the Relativity platform for the case US v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is an email from March 25, 2021, concerning the case US v. Epstein.
The correspondence involves individuals with USANYS (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) email addresses.
The subject is technical coordination regarding loading scanning data to the Relativity platform, an e-discovery software commonly used in legal cases.
A vendor named PAE is mentioned as also needing to be part of the discussion.
